description: Bad hexadecimal notation for n: write n in hexadecimal notation, replacing digit ten by "10", digit eleven by "11", ... and digit fifteen by "15".
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: a(15)=15 since it is represented by the digit "15" base 16. a(21)=15 since it is represented by the digit "1" followed by the digit "5" base 16.
maple: a:= proc(n) local i, m, r ; m:=n; r:=NULL;      if n=0 then return 0 fi;      for i from 0 while m>0 do        r:= irem(m, 16, 'm'), r      od; parse(cat(r))    end:seq(a(n), n=0..80);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 23 2014
mathematica: f[n_] := FromDigits@ Flatten@ IntegerDigits@ IntegerDigits[n, 16]; Array[f, 66, 0] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 23 2014 *)
crossrefs: Cf. A057947 for ambiguous numbers, A055645 for a better representation of hexadecimal.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Oct 13 2000
